summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 forwarding information from Norwegian authorities to the U.S. Department of Justice regarding the Epstein case. The information concerns donations from Jeffrey Epstein to the International Peace Institute in New York, provided by an unnamed woman to a Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs employee.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the ongoing U.S. investigation; mentioned in relation to donations made to the International Peace Institute in New York.

events.title: Norwegian Information Provided
events.description: The Norwegian Director of Public Prosecutions, on behalf of the Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, sends information regarding Jeffrey Epstein's donations to the International Peace Institute to a liaison prosecutor at Eurojust.

events.title: Information Forwarded to U.S. DOJ
events.description: A U.S. Liaison Prosecutor at Eurojust forwards the information received from Norwegian partners to the U.S. Department of Justice for the ongoing Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: Norwegian authorities provided information to the U.S. regarding Jeffrey Epstein's donations to the International Peace Institute in New York.
The information was provided by an unnamed woman to an employee of the Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs; her identity is available upon request.
The communication highlights international cooperation in the Epstein investigation, involving Eurojust and the U.S. Department of Justice's Office of International Affairs.
The document is part of a chain of correspondence forwarding a tip from December 2019 to U.S. authorities in January 2020.
